intro: Acetosella barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Its foliage contains oxalic acid, giving it a tart flavor and making it a subject of interest in botanical and culinary studies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
